arts.ttl: Ronaldo sees red as Republic of Ireland stun Portugal in World Cup qualifying
arts.sum: Cristiano Ronaldo was sent off as Republic of Ireland stunned Portugal with a 2-0 win and forced Roberto Martinez's side to wait to qualify for the 2026 World Cup.

arts.ttl: CR7 sees red as Parrott brace boosts Republic of Ireland's World Cup dream
arts.sum: Troy Parrott scores twice as Republic of Ireland record a 2-0 victory over 10-man Portugal in Thursday night's 2026 World Cup qualification fixture in Dublin.

arts.ttl: Cristiano Ronaldo sent off as Troy Parrottâ€™s brace earns Ireland famous victory
arts.sum: Ireland head for Hungary on Sunday knowing victory would secure runners-up spot in Group F.

arts.ttl: Celticâ€™s Liam Scales assists for Ireland as Cristiano Ronaldo sent off in Dublin
arts.sum: Celtic defender Liam Scales laid on an assist for Ireland against Portugal this evening. The central defender has been excellent this season in what has been a difficult time for the club and he continued that with a header across the six yard box for Troy Parrott to take the lead. ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª Liam Scales with Read More

arts.ttl: Cristiano Ronaldo loses his head and sees red as Portugal face shock Ireland result
arts.sum: Portugal are without captain Cristiano Ronaldo as they try to overhaul a two-goal deficit against the Republic of Ireland at the Aviva Stadium in their penultimate World Cup qualifier

arts.ttl: Cristiano Ronaldo sees RED: Portugal star is sent off for ELBOWING Ireland opponent before giving sarcastic response to decision - and he could miss country's World Cup opener
arts.sum: Cristiano Ronaldo was handed his first ever international red card on Thursday after throwing a frustrated elbow at Ireland defender Dara O'Shea.

arts.ttl: Republic of Ireland v Portugal, France v Ukraine, and more: World Cup 2026 qualifying â€“ live
arts.sum: âš½ World Cup qualifying updates, 7.45pm GMT kick-offs âš½ Live scores | England v Serbia â€“ live | Email Luke This was Edâ€™s take on Group I. Norway are now six points clear of Italy â€¦ Norway lead Italy by three points and no one else can finish in the top two. A win for Norway at home to Estonia on Thursday would in effect secure qualification before they travel to San Siro on Sunday because the astonishing 29 goals plundered by Erling Haaland and co from six matches have given the team a frankly ridiculous goal difference of +26, 16 ahead of Italy. Gennaro Gattusoâ€™s side need maximum points from their games, which start in Moldova on Thursday, and a Norway slip against Estonia to avoid the playoff for which they appear destined as they try to qualify for a first World Cup since 2014.
